metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17336 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
UDisks 2.8.0 has a format string vulnerability in udisks_log inudiskslogging.c, allowing attackers to obtain sensitive information (stackcontents), cause a denial of service (memory corruption), or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a malformed filesystem label, as demonstratedby %d or %n substrings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-udisks-2.0 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
libudisks2-0 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2-btrfs - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
udisks2-lvm2 - 2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: udisks2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-3ubuntu0.2').
